subelement_relations.Description: Public disclosure is a key component of transparency and accountability mechanisms. It involves the proactive release of information by governments, organizations, or individuals to ensure transparency and enable public scrutiny.

Audit and evaluation processes are essential for ensuring transparency and accountability. They involve the systematic examination and assessment of financial records, performance, and compliance with regulations and standards.

Whistleblower protection is a crucial aspect of transparency and accountability mechanisms. It involves providing legal safeguards and support to individuals who report wrongdoing or misconduct in organizations or governments.

Anti-corruption measures are integral to transparency and accountability mechanisms. They include policies, laws, and actions aimed at preventing, detecting, and addressing corruption in both public and private sectors.

Open data initiatives contribute to transparency and accountability by making data accessible and available to the public. They involve the release of data in a machine-readable format, enabling analysis, innovation, and informed decision-making.
